data.text:
Introduction

What is “Resurrection Walk” about? “Resurrection Walk” follows defense attorney Mickey Haller as he battles to free a woman wrongfully convicted of her husband’s murder. He teams up with his half-brother, retired LAPD Detective Harry Bosch, to uncover the truth behind the case. Their journey through the intricacies and dangers of the legal system is filled with twists and suspense.

Book Details

Title: Resurrection Walk

Author: Michael Connelly

Pages: 417

Genre: Mystery, Fiction, Crime, Thriller, Legal Thriller

First Published: October 31, 2023

Formats Available: Kindle Edition

Series: The Lincoln Lawyer (#7), Harry Bosch (#37)

Synopsis of Resurrection Walk

The Return of Mickey Haller

Mickey Haller, defense attorney, thrives on taking the toughest cases. These usually have a slim chance of winning. Fresh off overturning a wrongful conviction, he’s now swamped with similar pleas. Inmates across the state are begging for his help, proclaiming their innocence. Knowing that most claims are exaggerations or lies, Mickey needs assistance.

Enter retired LAPD Detective Harry Bosch, Mickey’s half-brother. Harry takes on the daunting task of reading through thousands of letters. It’s here that he finds an unusual case. A woman, Lucinda Sanz, is in prison for killing her husband, a sheriff’s deputy. She insists on her innocence. Bosch digs deeper into her case and discovers inconsistencies that don’t make sense. The sheriff’s department appears to have rushed to judgment, perhaps because the victim was one of their own.

The Investigation Begins

Bosch and Haller make a great team, each complementing the other’s skills. While Bosch reviews police reports and uncovers irregularities, Mickey prepares for the legal battle ahead. Evidence suggests that Lucinda may have been framed. The stakes are high, as reopening the case puts them in direct conflict with the sheriff’s department, who are determined to keep the case closed.

Mickey’s legal acumen shines as he navigates the tricky courtroom dynamics. From questioning the credibility of witnesses to presenting new evidence, he leaves no stone unturned. Meanwhile, Bosch faces his own set of challenges. His investigative work ruffles feathers within the police department, causing him to tread carefully.

Legal Maneuvering and Courtroom Drama

Courtroom scenes offer a mix of tension and humor. Mickey’s methods often frustrate judges and prosecutors. He walks a fine line, stretching the rules but never quite breaking them. His goal is clear: to prove Lucinda’s innocence. As the trial progresses, new revelations emerge. There’s evidence of corruption within the sheriff’s department, which is infuriating for both Bosch and Haller.

The story’s legal intricacies are balanced by Bosch’s hands-on investigation. Harry uses his experience to see beyond the obvious, focusing on details others might overlook. The duo’s persistence starts paying off. However, they must be cautious. Several powerful individuals have a vested interest in keeping the case closed.

Culmination and Impact

As the trial reaches its climax, the tension is palpable. Mickey pulls out all the stops, employing legal strategies to keep the jury engaged. Bosch’s evidence challenges the prosecution’s narrative, creating doubt about Lucinda’s guilt. Their combined efforts lead to a jaw-dropping conclusion, where truth and justice prevail.

“Resurrection Walk” demonstrates Michael Connelly’s adeptness at delivering gripping crime fiction. The partnership between Mickey Haller and Harry Bosch brings out the best in both characters. Their dynamic, marked by mutual respect and occasional banter, adds layers to their personalities.

Connelly’s knack for detail extends beyond the courtroom. He ensures that technological advances in crime-solving, like AI and geo-fencing, are seamlessly woven into the plot. This gives the story modern relevance and makes the fictional events strikingly plausible.

In the end, the case of Lucinda Sanz serves as another proof to the power of determined advocacy and relentless investigation. Both Haller and Bosch emerge as heroes committed to justice. “Resurrection Walk” is a thrilling ride from start to finish, solidifying Connelly’s reputation as a master storyteller in crime fiction.

Harry Bosch: Retired LAPD detective and half-brother to Haller.

Lucinda Sanz: Woman imprisoned for killing her husband, a sheriff’s deputy.

Renee Ballard: LAPD detective who assists in the investigation.

About Michael Connelly

Michael Connelly is a former journalist turned novelist, recognized for his gripping crime fiction. He developed a passion for crime writing after discovering Raymond Chandler’s works. Connelly’s experience as a crime reporter significantly influenced his writing. He has published over 30 novels, many featuring LAPD Detective Harry Bosch. Connelly’s books have sold over 80 million copies worldwide and have been translated into 45 languages.

FAQs about Resurrection Walk

Is “Resurrection Walk” part of a series? Yes, it’s the 7th book in The Lincoln Lawyer series and the 37th in the Harry Bosch series.

Do I need to read the previous books? It’s helpful but not necessary; the book can be enjoyed as a standalone.

What themes does the book explore? Justice, corruption, family dynamics, and perseverance.
